history.summary: Elderwyn was once unified under the High Kingdom of Arcloren, but following the Great Barrow War and the fall of the royal bloodline, the realm broke into feuding territories. Ancient magic stirs again as old powers awaken beneath forgotten ruins.

timeline.details: The first High King united the human clans, dwarven holds, and elven courts into a single realm of peace backed by the Arcloren Pact.
Necromantic cults rose from the Eastern Barrows, unleashing undead armies that ravaged the kingdom. Victory came at the cost of the royal family's extinction.
Without an heir, the realm fractured into quarrelling kingdoms. Old alliances broke, and forgotten magic re-emerged as warlords, nobles, and guilds compete for power.

geography.Greenhearth Valley: A fertile region once considered the breadbasket of Arcloren. Now contested by rival barons.
geography.The Ironspine Mountains: Home to deep dwarven citadels, rich mines, and ancient beasts that dwell in abandoned tunnels.
geography.Evertide Forest: A vast, enchanted woodland where the Glade Elves reside. Outsiders rarely leave without being changed by the forest’s magic.
geography.The Eastern Barrows: Grim burial mounds where necromancers once raised armies. Many barrows remain sealed… others do not.

Arcloren Remnant.description: Knights, scholars, and loyalists who still believe the High Kingdom can be restored.
Arcloren Remnant.motives: Find a lost heir, real or symbolic, to reunify Elderwyn.
Arcloren Remnant.current_status: Respected but weakened; their strongholds hold only a fraction of their former glory.

The Black Ash Legion.description: Mercenary warbands formed from deserters, criminals, and exiled warriors. Feared for their brutality.
The Black Ash Legion.motives: Seize land and power by force; many leaders aim to crown themselves king.
The Black Ash Legion.current_status: Their influence is spreading across battle-scarred regions.

The Circle of Oak.description: A druidic order tied to ancient natural magic. They guard sacred groves and ancient forest spirits.
The Circle of Oak.motives: Prevent the reckless spread of war that threatens the wilds.
The Circle of Oak.current_status: Respected by many rural folk, distrusted by nobles.

Guild of the Silver Quill.description: An influential mage guild dedicated to rediscovering lost spells and pre-Barrow War lore.
Guild of the Silver Quill.motives: Recover forbidden magical texts to restore arcane mastery.
Guild of the Silver Quill.current_status: Growing quickly, but their experiments often provoke fear and suspicion.

The Old Gods.description: Ancient deities once worshipped before the rise of Arcloren — gods of earth, storm, hunt, death, and fire.
current_beliefs: Some rural folk still make offerings at old-standing stones.
Nobles consider the Old Gods superstition… until strange omens appear.

The Barrow Lords.description: Legendary necromancers who ruled the Eastern Barrows centuries ago. Their spirits were believed destroyed, but their names linger on grim tombs.
rumors: Some say one Barrow Lord never died.
Others claim a new cult works to resurrect them.

The Forgeheart Relic.description: A mythical dwarven artifact said to grant unmatched craftsmanship and power when wielded by a worthy ruler.
The Forgeheart Relic.significance: Many dwarven clans search tirelessly for it, hoping it can unite their fractured people.

Humans.description: Adaptable and ambitious, found in every corner of Elderwyn.

Dwarves.description: Stoic mountainfolk known for metalwork, runes, and deep traditions.

Elves.description: Graceful spell-touched beings from the deep forests, long-lived and attuned to nature.

Half-Orcs.description: Strong warriors born of human and orc heritage, often misunderstood but formidable.

adventure_hooks: A noble’s son has disappeared after exploring a newly unearthed barrow.
A village accuses the Circle of Oak of stealing their livestock, but the truth is far darker.
The Silver Quill discovers a spell sealed since the Barrow War — and now something hunts anyone who has read it.
A warlord of the Black Ash Legion claims to possess the Forgeheart Relic.
